intro: Helianthopsis matthewsii, commonly known as the Matthew's sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange ray florets and dark purple disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, hairy leaves and has a compact, bushy growth habit. Helianthopsis matthewsii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
